origination.corpname: Vietnam Veterans of America, Inc. Chapter 9 (Detroit, Mich.)

did.unittitle: Vietnam Veterans of America, Chapter 9 (Detroit, Mich.) records 1973-2011 1980-1997
did.abstract: This collection includes material regarding the activities of the Vietnam Veterans of America, Inc., Chapter 9 (Detroit, Mich.). Some members of this group have also been involved in the Vietnam Veterans of America (VVA) State of Michigan Council, as well as the Michigan Veterans Trust Fund and Vietnam Monument Commission so materials from these groups have also been included in this collection.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The records were received from the organization (donor no. 7420) in 1987. Additions were received in 2001 and September 2013.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Vietnam Veterans of America, Chapter 9 (Detroit, Mich.) Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Vietnam Veterans of America, Chapter 9, Detroit, an affiliated chapter of the national organization Vietnam Veterans of America Inc., is a service and fraternal organization of men and women who served in the U.S. Military during the Vietnam era. Membership is open to all veterans who served on active duty during the period August 5, 1964 to May 5, 1975 or who served in Vietnam at any time. About 90 percent of Chapter 9 members are Vietnam combat veterans.

Originally organized ca. 1978-1979 as Vietnam Veterans of Michigan, Chapter 9 was incorporated as a non profit corporation with the State of Michigan in April 1981. Chapter 9 membership was about 650 in 1987, making Detroit the largest local VVA chapter in the country. It has played an influential role in the national organization, sending several members to serve as national officers and hosting the 1985 national convention.

Chapter 9 sponsors a variety of individual and group counseling programs for Vietnam-era veterans, with special emphasis on post-traumatic stress disorder, agent orange, drug and alcohol abuse, employment, and Veterans Administration claims assistance. Other chapter activities include lobbying for legislation beneficial to veterans, conducting public education programs in schools, churches, and civic organizations, and participating in community development projects, particularly in the Woodward Avenue neighborhood of its headquarters and service center.

Keith King, the donor of this collection, was a founding, and life, member of VVA's Chapter 9. He has served three consecutive terms as the Chairman of the State of Michigan Council and State Commissioner of the Michigan Vietnam Monument Commission. He was also appointed a Trustee of the Michigan Veterans Trust Fund and served as the Chairman of the Board of Trustees from 1996-1998 and 2001-2002.

The Michigan Veterans Trust Fund is a program under the Department of Military and Veterans Affairs that provides assistance to veterans or their families facing temporary financial hardship. Some Vietnam Veterans of America representatives serve on the board of this program.

The Vietnam Monument Commission was formed for the purpose creating memorial monument for Vietnam veterans in the state of Michigan. This commission began its work in 1990 and through fundraising efforts and design competitions aided in the creation of a monument built in Lansing in 2001.

scopecontent.p: This collection has five series: Vietnam Veterans of America, Inc. Chapter 9 (Detroit), Vietnam Veterans of America, Inc., Michigan Veterans Trust Fund, Vietnam Monument Commission, and Audio and visual material. Records in this collection include administrative documents, Vietnam Veterans of American national convention materials, and VVA chapter newsletters and publications.

scopecontent.p: The America, Chapter 9, Detroit series includes the chapter bylaws and articles of incorporation, financial records, history of the chapter, an index of members, and chapter newsletters from Chapter 9, as well as other Michigan chapters. There are separate sets of minutes for the General Membership meeting (October 1981-January 1987), the Board of Directors (September 1981-December 1986), and the Executive Board (September 1981-September 1983 and May-August 1985). There is some information regarding Keith King and his veterans affairs involvement and campaign for national VVA president in 1985.

odd.p: (Television production created for Veterans, produced by B.J. Mercado and son Charles Mercado)

odd.p: (Pg. 565 features a picture with Vietnam Veterans of America at the Wall monument in D.C.)

scopecontent.p: The Vietnam Veterans of America, Inc. series includes national convention materials from six conventions, newspaper articles, the "Veteran" national newsletter, a directory, and a report to members regarding legal, constitutional, and internal issues. The State of Michigan Council documents contain meeting minutes, material on POWs/MIAs and women veterans, as well as documents collected by Marilyn Edgerton-Mallard, who served on this council, was a member of the VVA Chapter 9, and was involved in work related to women veterans.

did.unittitle: Chapter directory, Board members, revenue, and communications 1985-1987
Report on legal, constitutional, and internal issues 2005
Council nominations to Michigan Veterans Trust Fund (MVTF) 1992
Prisoner of war committee of Michigan 1987-1988

scopecontent.p: The Michigan Veterans Trust Fund series contains directories, documents from the Board of Trustees, laws regarding the trust fund, as well as audit and annual reports.

did.unittitle: Board policy manual and fact sheet 1996
Michigan veteran laws for trust fund 1996
Status update and Vietnam Veterans of America (VVA) representatives 1995-1996

scopecontent.p: The Vietnam Monument Commission contains material that documents the process of the commission as it worked towards its goal of creating a monument in Michigan. Included are paper and radio advertisement materials, communications with advertising companies, and fundraising conducted by the commission. There are also documents about the competition the commission held to determine a design for the monument, the monument proposal, and the dedication of the monument in 2001.

did.unittitle: Keith King-public relations chair and commissioner 1993-1995
Michigan personnel who died in war 1992
Michigan Vietnam veteran memorials and monument 1995

scopecontent.p: The Audio and Visual Materials series includes cassette tapes with recorded stories and interviews, some from the radio. Some of the recordings are of Keith King, Michigan resident and the Vietnam War veteran who collected a large portion of the Vietnam Veterans of America, Chapter 9 (Detroit, Mich.) records collection. The VHS tapes and DVDs contain recordings of the "AMVET story continues...", and about Vietnam monuments. Ephemera including buttons, bumper stickers, and pins are also in this series.
